slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचभूय एव महाबाहो श‍ृणु मे परमं वच: ।यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: “Lord Shri Krishna said: Now, O Prince! Listen to My supreme advice, which I give you for the sake of your welfare, for you are My beloved.

slokas: न मे विदु: सुरगणा: प्रभवं न महर्षय: ।अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वश: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Neither the professors of divinity nor the great ascetics know My origin, for I am the source of them all.

slokas: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् ।असम्मूढ: स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापै: प्रमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: He who knows Me as the unborn, without beginning, the Lord of the universe, he, stripped of his delusion, becomes free from all conceivable sin.

slokas: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोह: क्षमा सत्यं दम: शम: ।सुखं दु:खं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Intelligence, wisdom, non-illusion, forgiveness, truth, self-control, calmness, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear and fearlessness;

slokas: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयश: ।भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधा: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Harmlessness, equanimity, contentment, austerity, beneficence, fame and failure, all these, the characteristics of beings, spring from Me only.

slokas: महर्षय: सप्‍त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा ।मद्भ‍ावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमा: प्रजा: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: The seven Great Seers, the Progenitors of mankind, the Ancient Four, and the Lawgivers were born of My Will and come forth direct from Me. The race of mankind has sprung from them.

slokas: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वत: ।सोऽविकल्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशय: ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: He who rightly understands My manifested glory and My Creative Power, beyond doubt attains perfect peace.

slokas: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्त: सर्वं प्रवर्तते ।इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विता: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the source of all; from Me everything flows. Therefore the wise worship Me with unchanging devotion.

slokas: मच्च‍ित्ता मद्ग‍तप्राणा बोधयन्त: परस्परम् ।कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: With minds concentrated on Me, with lives absorbed in Me, and enlightening each other, they ever feel content and happy.

slokas: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ।ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: To those who are always devout and who worship Me with love, I give the power of discrimination, which leads them to Me.

slokas: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तम: ।नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: By My grace, I live in their hearts; and I dispel the darkness of ignorance by the shining light of wisdom.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचपरं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् ।पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna asked: You are the Supreme Spirit, the Eternal Home, the Holiest of the Holy, the Eternal Divine Self, the Primal God, the Unborn and the Omnipresent.

slokas: आहुस्त्वामृषय: सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा ।असितो देवलो व्यास: स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: So have said the seers and the divine sage Narada; as well as Asita, Devala and Vyasa; and You Yourself also say it.

slokas: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव ।न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवा: ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: I believe in what You have said, my Lord! For neither the godly not the godless comprehend Your manifestation.

slokas: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम ।भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: You alone know Yourself, by the power of Your Self; You the Supreme Spirit, the Source and Master of all being, the Lord of Lords, the Ruler of the Universe.

slokas: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: ।याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Please tell me all about Your glorious manifestations, by means of which You pervade the world.

slokas: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् ।केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: O Master! How shall I, by constant meditation, know You? My Lord! What are Your various manifestations through which I am to mediate on You?

slokas: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन ।भूय: कथय तृप्‍तिर्हि श‍ृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Tell me again, I pray, about the fullness of Your power and Your glory; for I feel that I am never satisfied when I listen to Your immortal words.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचहन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: ।प्राधान्यत: कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: Lord Shri Krishna replied: So be it, My beloved friend! I will unfold to you some of the chief aspects of My glory. Of its full extent there is no end.

slokas: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थित: ।अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: O Arjuna! I am the Self, seated in the hearts of all beings; I am the beginning and the life, and I am the end of them all.

slokas: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंश‍ुमान् ।मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Of all the creative Powers I am the Creator, of luminaries the Sun; the Whirlwind among the winds, and the Moon among planets.

slokas: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासव: ।इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the Vedas I am the Hymns, I am the Electric Force in the Powers of Nature; of the senses I am the Mind; and I am the Intelligence in all that lives.

slokas: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् ।वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरु: शिखरिणामहम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Among Forces of Vitality I am the life, I am Mammon to the heathen and the godless; I am the Energy in fire, earth, wind, sky, heaven, sun, moon and planets; and among mountains I am the Mount Meru.

slokas: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् ।सेनानीनामहं स्कन्द: सरसामस्मि सागर: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Among the priests, know, O Arjuna, that I am the Apostle Brihaspati; of generals I am Skanda, the Commander-in-Chief, and of waters I am the Ocean.

slokas: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् ।यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालय: ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the great seers I am Bhrigu, of words I am Om, of offerings I am the silent prayer, among things immovable I am the Himalayas.

slokas: अश्वत्थ: सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारद: ।गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथ: सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनि: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: Of trees I am the sacred Fig-tree, of the Divine Seers Narada, of the heavenly singers I am Chitraratha, their Leader, and of sages I am Kapila.

slokas: उच्‍चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भ‍वम् ।ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: Know that among horses I am Pegasus, the heaven-born; among the lordly elephants I am the White one, and I am the Ruler among men.

slokas: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् ।प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्प: सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकि: ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Thunderbolt among weapons; of cows I am the Cow of Plenty, I am Passion in those who procreate, and I am the Cobra among serpents.

slokas: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् ।पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यम: संयमतामहम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the King-python among snakes, I am the Aqueous Principle among those that live in water, I am the Father of fathers, and among rulers I am Death.

slokas: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां काल: कलयतामहम् ।मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: And I am the devotee Prahlad among the heathen; of Time I am the Eternal Present; I am the Lion among beasts and the Eagle among birds.

slokas: पवन: पवतामस्मि राम: शस्त्रभृतामहम् ।झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Wind among purifiers, the King Rama among warriors; I am the Crocodile among the fishes, and I am the Ganges among rivers.

slokas: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन ।अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वाद: प्रवदतामहम् ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Beginning, the Middle and the End in creation; among sciences, I am the science of Spirituality; I am the Discussion among disputants.

slokas: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्व: सामासिकस्य च ।अहमेवाक्षय: कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुख: ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: Of letters I am A; I am the copulative in compound words; I am Time inexhaustible; and I am the all-pervading Preserver.

slokas: मृत्यु: सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भ‍वश्च भविष्यताम् ।कीर्ति: श्रीर्वाक्‍च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृति: क्षमा ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: I am all-devouring Death; I am the Origin of all that shall happen; I am Fame, Fortune, Speech, Memory, Intellect, Constancy and Forgiveness.

slokas: बृहत्साम तथा साम्न‍ां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् ।मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकर: ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: Of hymns I am Brihatsama, of metres I am Garatri, among the months I am Margasheersha (December), and I am the Spring among seasons.

slokas: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ।जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Gambling of the cheat and the Splendour of the splendid; I am Victory; I am Effort; and I am the Purity of the pure.

slokas: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जय: ।मुनीनामप्यहं व्यास: कवीनामुशना कवि: ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas_translated: I am Shri Krishna among the Vishnu-clan and Arjuna among the Pandavas; of the saints I am Vyasa, and I am Shukracharya among the sages.

slokas: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् ।मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Sceptre of rulers, the Strategy of the conquerors, the Silence of mystery, the Wisdom of the wise.

slokas: यच्च‍ापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन ।न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Seed of all being, O Arjuna! No creature moving or unmoving can live without Me.

slokas: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप ।एष तूद्देशत: प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: O Arjuna! The aspects of My divine life are endless. I have mentioned but a few by way of illustration.

slokas: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा ।तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोऽशसम्भवम् ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: Whatever is glorious, excellent, beautiful and mighty, be assured that it comes from a fragment of My splendour.

slokas: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन ।विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: But what is the use of all these details to you? O Arjuna! I sustain this universe with only small part of Myself.”
